scratchcloud docs

scratchcloud.client module

class scratchcloud.client.CloudChange(name: str, value: str, id: int, previous_value: Optional[str] = None, sender=None)

Bases: object

This is a class that stores cloud data received from client.CloudClient.

Parameters

  • name (str) – the cloud variable’s name excluding “☁️ “

  • value (str) – the cloud variable’s value If an encoder is specified in client.CloudClient this value will be encoded

  • id (int) – the cloud variable’s id

  • previous_value (str, optional) – the cloud variable’s previous value Never encoded. None if not found

  • sender – the cloud variable’s sender If sent from the client, will default to the username attribute of client.CloudClient. None otherwise

  • sender – str

class scratchcloud.client.CloudClient(username: str, project_id: str, max_reconnect: Optional[int] = None, reconnect_cooldown: int = 10, encoder: Optional[Callable[[str], str]] = None, decoder: Optional[Callable[[str], str]] = None, disconnect_messages: bool = False)

Bases: object

Represents the connection with the scratch websocket server.

Parameters

  • username (str) – the username of the account that will be used

  • project_id (str) – the project id that will be connected to

  • max_reconnect (int, optional) – the maximum number of reconnects by the client. Used in run

  • reconnect_cooldown (int, optional) – the time in seconds between reconnecting. Used in run, defaults to 10

  • encoder (Callable[[str], str], optional) – a callable function that is used to encode all sent cloud data. Must convert to string of digits. Must take 1 argument

  • decoder (Callable[[str], str], optional) – a callable function that is used to decode all received cloud data. Must take 1 argument

  • disconnect_messages (bool) – a boolean that when true, prints the cause of disconnects, defaults to False

async close()

A coroutine that closes self.http_session.

cloud_event(variable_name: str)

A wrapper that registers cloud events.

Parameters

  • variable_name – The variable name that will be registered

  • variable_name – str

Raises

KeyError – If the cloud variable has already been registered

cloud_event_error(variable_name: str)

A wrapper that registers cloud error events.

Parameters

  • variable_name – The variable name that will be registered

  • variable_name – str

Raises

KeyError – If the cloud variable has already been registered

async connect_ws()

A coroutine that establishes a websocket connection with project_id.

event(func)

A wrapper that registers on_message, on_connect, and, on_disconnect events.

Parameters

  • func – A function that will be registered. Must have an identical name to an event

  • func – Callable

async login(token: str) → None

A coroutine that sets http_session, cookies, and headers.

Parameters

token (str) – the password of the account that will be used to establish a connection

async on_connect()

The default value for on_connect.

async on_connect_task()

A coroutine that calls on_connect.

async on_disconnect()

The default value for on_disconnect.

async on_disconnect_task()

A coroutine that calls on_disconnect.

async on_message(content)

The default value for on_message.

Parameters

content (client.CloudChange) – A cloudchange object that stores data from on_recv

async on_recv()

A coroutine that receives data from the cloud connection and calls event functions.

parse_raw_cloud(raw_data: str) → dict

A method that parses data received directly from the websocket

Parameters

raw_data (str) – The data to be parsed

Return type

dict

run(token: str)

Functions as a blocking function to run the client with builtin reconnecting. Basically runs start repeatedly and disconnects properly after a keyboardinterrupt. Also handles common connection errors.

Parameters

token (str) – the password of the account that will be used to establish a connection

Return type

None

async run_client()

A coroutine that calls the on_connect_task and starts receving data from the websocket.

async set_cloud(name: str, value: str, encode: bool = True)

A coroutine that sets cloud variables by sending data to the websocket connection.

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the cloud variable that will be set

  • value (str) – The value the cloud variable will be set to

  • encode (bool) – Controls whether, if the client has an encoder, the encoder be used

Raises

  • TypeError – If the (possibly encoded) value is not digits

  • SizeError – If the value is larger than 256 digits

async start(token: str)

A coroutine that starts a client. Basically just calls other functions in chronological order. Closes self, logs in, connects to the websocket, performs a handshake, and finally, runs the client.

Parameters

token (str) – the password of the account that will be used to establish a connection

async ws_handshake()

A coroutine that performs a handshake with the websocket connection.

Raises

errors.MissingCloudVariable – If no cloud variables are found in the project

async ws_send(data: dict)

A coroutine that sends a dictionary to the websocket connection.

class scratchcloud.client.RawCloudChange(name: str, value: str, id: int, previous_value: Optional[str] = None, sender=None)

Bases: scratchcloud.client.CloudChange

A subclass of client.CloudChange. Value attribute wil never be encoded.

scratchcloud.errors module

exception scratchcloud.errors.DecodeError

Bases: scratchcloud.errors.ScratchCloudException

Decode Error. Raised when there is an issue with decoding.

exception scratchcloud.errors.EncodeError

Bases: scratchcloud.errors.ScratchCloudException

Encode Error. Raised when there is an issue with encoding.

exception scratchcloud.errors.MissingCloudVariable

Bases: scratchcloud.errors.ScratchCloudException

Missing Cloud Variable. Raised when specified cloud variables are missing, or when a project doesn’t have cloud variables.

exception scratchcloud.errors.NotFoundError

Bases: scratchcloud.errors.ScratchCloudException

Not Found Error. Raised when data from the API is not found.

exception scratchcloud.errors.ScratchCloudException

Bases: Exception

Base ScratchCloud exception. Use this to catch all exceptions raised by this library.

exception scratchcloud.errors.SizeError

Bases: scratchcloud.errors.ScratchCloudException

Size Error. Raised when a cloud variable payload is too large.

exception scratchcloud.errors.UnableToValidate

Bases: scratchcloud.errors.ScratchCloudException

UnableToValidate. Raised when an issue occurs with username validation.
